caption_text: Veratrylglycol $ guaiacyl ether (VGE) and guaiacylglycol s guaiacyl ether (GGE), shown in Fig. 1, and which differ only in the free phenolic hydroxyl present on GGE, faithfully mimic lignin s ethers. Experiments with these model compounds reported upon herein extended previous work (Klein and Virk, 1983; Domburg, 1g79) and provided model pathway and intrinsic kinetics for the lignln s ethers. The experimental details of the reactant source, the reactor description, and the analytical chemistry protocols are described elsewhere (McDermott and others, 1~8b), Briefly, essentially Isothermal batch reactions of VGE and GGE were performed in tubing bomb reactors immersed in a heated sand bath.
raw_window: Veratrylglycol $ guaiacyl ether (VGE) and guaiacylglycol s guaiacyl ether (GGE), shown in Fig. 1, and which differ only in the free phenolic hydroxyl present on GGE, faithfully mimic lignin s ethers.
Experiments with these model compounds reported upon herein extended previous work (Klein and Virk, 1983; Domburg, 1g79) and provided model pathway and intrinsic kinetics for the lignln s ethers.

The experimental details of the reactant source, the reactor description, and the analytical chemistry protocols are described elsewhere (McDermott and others, 1~8b), Briefly, essentially Isothermal batch reactions of VGE and GGE were performed in tubing bomb reactors immersed in a heated sand bath.

caption_text: Development of an arbitrary linear polymer with a degree of polymerization of 11 (10 bonds) allows demonstration, The Markov chain illustrated in Fig. 3 is the reaction trajectory for one 0-0-0-00-00-0-0-00 4 0-0-00 0-~ 0-0-0-00 ~ Fig. 3, Random reaction trajectory of a linear polymer polymer; each downward arrow represents the passage of one at. The Monte Carlo simulation of the polymer depolymerization consisted of a collection of these independent Markov chains with the result reflecting an equal contribution from each Markov chain. Figure 4 summarizes the simulations both for the case of equally reactive bonds and also for the case where bond cleavage activates an adjacent bond by an order of magnitude.
raw_window: Development of an arbitrary linear polymer with a degree of polymerization of 11 (10 bonds) allows demonstration, The Markov chain illustrated in Fig. 3 is the reaction trajectory for one 0-0-0-00-00-0-0-00 4 0-0-00 0-~ 0-0-0-00 ~ Fig. 3, Random reaction trajectory of a linear polymer polymer; each downward arrow represents the passage of one at.
The Monte Carlo simulation of the polymer depolymerization consisted of a collection of these independent Markov chains with the result reflecting an equal contribution from each Markov chain.
Figure 4 summarizes the simulations both for the case of equally reactive bonds and also for the case where bond cleavage activates an adjacent bond by an order of magnitude.

caption_text: For the tenfold Increase illustrated in Fig. 4, the polymer tends to unzip once the first bond is broken and yields a non Flory distribution of molecular sizes. This Intuitive result would have been difficult to predict quantitatively in any deterministic calculation, as would be intermediate cases where bond activation was not so large. Simulation of a Model Lignin A simple but illustrative model of lignin is a linear polymer of 5 ethers (polyVsE).
